column9: I have a medical professional comment here about Roxicodone and addiction versus legitimate need.  I have been taking Norco (Hydrocodone/ Acetaminophen 10/325) for about 6 years, along with a 100mcg Fentanyl patch, and the occ. use of Robaxin for muscle spasms, and have had really good maintenance.  I have Lupus, RA, fibromyalgia, and lost a leg above the knee to an infection mixed with a stupid nurse mistake.  I just saw a pain management doc for the first time and he put me on Roxicodone IR 10mg 4x/day.  I am a nurse (30+years), so I was aware of the benefits vs problems of taking this med.  I have to tell all of you that there is one thing you need to know and always remember regarding addiction/dependency for any pain med.  If you take the medication because you are in pain, and for NO OTHER REASON, then you are NOT an addict.  If you take the pill because you think you may be in pain later, or because you want to sleep, or get high, or for any other reason, then you are an addict.  Dependency is a word that needs careful use.  You are dependent on air, water, food.  As for me, using Roxicodone may not be, as I immediatly got short of breath, my heart rate went up to 194bpm (not a common response), and I started itching more than I ever have before.  Itching goes with Lupus, but this was much worse.  Anyway, if people give you a hard time about the (proper) use of these meds for your pain management, offer to let them walk a mile or 10 in your moccasins, so they can judge you without being such a pitiful idiot.  Good Luck, and Blessed Be.
